results.title: Athletics: the sprint
results.creator_credit: Colin Moffat, Elizabeth Isaacs, Dan Productions and Guardian Royal Exchange Assurance
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sports training film series”.
One of a series of athletics training films. Looks at the sprinter with particular emphasis given to the development of running skills and starting from the blocks. Narrated by Ron Pickering.

results.title: 34 years after Hitler
results.creator_credit: William K McClure and CBS News
results.brief_description: Looks at neo-Nazi groups in Germany today that have been known to destroy Jewish cemeteries, paint swastikas on the street and distribute anti-Semitic propaganda. While not viewed as a flourishing movement on the verge of popular acceptance, the neo-Nazis are shown to be a group whose philosophy and immediate predecessors demand that their activities be put into proper perspective.

results.title: The Living savanna
results.creator_credit: Richard Brock, British Broadcasting Corporation and British Petroleum
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Web of life”.
Includes scenes of wildlife in East Africa and shows how the various animals fit into the ecosystem. Also shows the effects of any alteration to the balance of nature. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Return of the sea elephant
results.creator_credit: Jacques-Yves Cousteau, Churchill Films and Wolper Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Undersea World of Jacques Cousteau”.
On the island of Guadalupe, 130 miles off the west coast of Mexico, there is a colony of unique aquatic mammals, the nosed sea elephants. On this trip, Cousteau and the crew of the Calypso examine the habits of these unusual animals and try to gather information as to the size of the herd, whether new colonies are forming and where they go in their seven months at sea. With Jacques Cousteau and narrated by Rod Serling.

results.title: Farm boy of Hungary
results.creator_credit: Gabor Kalman and Vue Touristique Film Studios
results.brief_description: The pace, feel, and values of the rural way of life that is still a part of Central Europe today. Lajos, a farm boy, is shown living the normal life in Hungary. Modern conveniences may be lacking, but Lajos and his family “have everything we need”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gabor Kalman and Vue Touristique Film Studios

results.title: Australia at school
results.creator_credit: Hugh Alexander, Geoffrey Collings and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows a range of schools from small country towns through to high schools in Sydney, grades from kindergarten to last year of high school. “A film outlining Australia’s system of primary and secondary education”. Cinematography by Frank Bagnall.

results.title: Trapper Murphy
results.creator_credit: Ronald Mason and Academy Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Describes the menace to sheep of dingoes and foxes in the Bogong High Plains in Victoria and shows something of the way in which they are being exterminated. Includes a shot of dingoes actually killing sheep at night.

Please be advised: this film includes scenes of animals being hunted and destroyed which may be distressing to viewers.

results.title: Mountain man
results.creator_credit: Terry Ohlsson and Ford Film Unit
results.brief_description: The 1964 Monte Carlo rally seen through the eyes of champion rally driver Vic Elford. With his partner David Stopne, driving a Cortina, Elford emerged from hazards of dust and fog, blinding sunlight and driving rain as winner of the touring category, with a class victory and a coveted Coupes des Alpes.
